title.narrative: Malawi - The National Water Development Program

description.narrative: The objective being the provision of safe water and sanitation through the National Water Development Programme (NWDP) for rural Malawi, as well as the enhancement of governance and capacity building in District and lower levels of Government for planning and implementation, which are all features of the RWSS component.
The rural water supply and sanitation (RWSS) component will benefit 4.45 million rural and district people in the four districts of Lilongwe Rural, Zomba, Mulanje and Machinga.

" The NWDP is a national program for the entire water sector. The Bank’s financing supports the following NWDP components: RWSS; Water Resources; and Program Management and Capacity Building. This intervention modality was chosen because the components align to RWSSI and the Bank’s Integrated Water Resources Management Policy, both of which contribute to implementing the National Water Policy, the draft National Sanitation Policy and the National Decentralisation Policy."

mailing-address.narrative: African Development Bank Group Headquarters Avenue Joseph Anoma 01 BP 1387 Abidjan 01, Côte d'Ivoire

sector.narrative: Water sector policy and administrative management
